summary: The Syria Sanctions Relief Act aims to repeal existing sanctions against the Syrian Arab Republic. Specifically, it seeks to repeal the Syria Human Rights Accountability Act of 2012 (Title VII of the Iran Threat Reduction and Syria Human Rights Act of 2012) and the Caesar Syria Civilian Protection Act of 2019 (Title LXXIV of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2020). The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives and referred to multiple committees, including Foreign Affairs, the Judiciary, and Financial Services.
